data.name: 4 Digit Pin Cracker
data.description:
The total possible number of pin combinations for a four digit pin is 10,000. A computer can crack an (unsalted) hash to a four digit pin very quickly. 

Your task is to take the SHA 256 hash of a four digit pin (only numbers from 0-9) and figure out what the combination is. 

For example the SHA-256 hash for the string '0123' is 1be2e452b46d7a0d9656bbb1f768e8248eba1b75baed65f5d99eafa948899a6a

You will write a function that accepts the hash and returns the pin as a string.

EXAMPLE:
888b19a43b151683c87895f6211d9f8640f97bdc8ef32f03dbe057c8f5e56d32 returns '0001'

HINT:
Python users will need to import hashlib.
I don't know about other languages.
